required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Buprenorphine Transdermal Patch in Subjects With Osteoarthritis Pain Requiring Opioids. Includes a 52-Week Safety Extension.
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study to Determine Efficacy and Safety of Buprenorphine Transdermal System in Subjects With Moderate To Severe Osteoarthritis Pain Requiring Daily Treatment With Opioids

brief_summary.textblock: The original objective of this study was to assess the safety and efficacy of the buprenorphine transdermal system (BTDS) (5, 10, and 20) in comparison to placebo transdermal system in subjects with moderate to severe osteoarthritis pain. However, this study was terminated early with only 35% of the planned sample size, therefore the primary objective is changed to focus on the safety evaluations.

detailed_description.textblock: Buprenorphine is a synthetic opioid analgesic with over 25 years of international clinical experience indicating it to be safe and effective in a variety of therapeutic situations for the relief of moderate to severe pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety
primary_outcome.description: For the Run-in and double-blind phases of the study, the focus of this study was changed before unblinding to a safety study due to early termination and having enrolled only 35% of the planned sample size. Therefore, the safety data is presented for the run-in and double-blind and overall exposure to BTDS, which includes the extension phase.

arm_group.description: Placebo to match buprenorphine transdermal patch 10 or 20

intervention.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patch applied for 7-day wear.
Placebo to match buprenorphine transdermal patch 10 or 20.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical evidence of osteoarthritis of the hip, knee, or spine joint for ≥ 1 year currently adequately treated with short acting opioids.
- taking ≥ 30 and ≤ 80 mg oral morphine or morphine equivalents per day for ≥ 2 weeks for control of their osteoarthritis pain.
Exclusion Criteria:
- requiring frequent analgesic therapy for chronic condition(s), other than osteoarthritis of the hip, knee, or spine.
- scheduled for surgery of the disease site (e.g., major joint replacement surgery), or any other major surgery that would fall within the study period.
Other protocol-specific exclusion/inclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences
Ormond Medical Arts Pharmaceutical Res Ctr
Advanced Pain Management and Rehab Hilltop Med Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 12-Dec-2003 (First Patient First Visit) 02-Mar-2005 (Last Patient Last Visit of Extension). At the time of early termination, 39 centers had screened subjects, 22 centers had randomized subjects to the double-blind phase.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects (N = 159) in the run-in period received BTDS 5 for the first 3 days, titrated to BTDS 10 or 20, continued stable nonopioid analgesic regimen for osteoarthritis (OA) pain, and took oxycodone immediate-release 5-mg capsules as supplemental analgesic therapy for primary OA pain site. N = 107 completed the run-in and were randomized.

group.title: Double-blind Placebo Patch
group.description: Reference Treatment placebo 10 or 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10/20
group.description: Test treatments buprenorphine transdermal patch (BTDS) 10 or BTDS 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Run-in Period BTDS 5/10/20
group.description: All subjects were started on BTDS 5 and titrated to BTDS 10 and 20. Subjects who met the protocol-specified criteria for adequate analgesia were eligible for entry into the double-blind phase. Subjects who could not tolerate at least BTDS 10 were discontinued from the study.

group.title: Extension Phase BTDS 5/10/20
group.description: Subjects who finished the entire 12-week (84-day) double-blind phase were eligible to participate in the open-label extension phase. Subjects began treatment with BTDS 5 and their doses were titrated to BTDS 10 or BTDS 20 as needed.

group.title: Double-blind Placebo Patch
group.description: Reference Treatment placebo 10 or 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS
group.description: Test treatments buprenorphine transdermal patch (BTDS) 10 or BTDS 20 applied for 7-day wear

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety
outcome.description: For the Run-in and double-blind phases of the study, the focus of this study was changed before unblinding to a safety study due to early termination and having enrolled only 35% of the planned sample size. Therefore, the safety data is presented for the run-in and double-blind and overall exposure to BTDS, which includes the extension phase.
outcome.population: The full analysis population consisted of all subjects who were randomized into the double-blind phase and received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment.

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Reference treatment placebo 10 or 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS
group.description: Test treatment buprenoprhine transdermal patch (BTDS) 10 or BTDS 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Run-in Period
group.description: All subjects were started on BTDS 5 and titrated to BTDS 10 and 20. Subjects who met the protocol-specified criteria for adequate analgesia were eligible for entry into the double-blind phase. Subjects who could not tolerate at least BTDS 10 were discontinued from the study.

group.title: Overall BTDS Exposure
group.description: Total number of subjects exposed to BTDS for overall study which includes the core study and extension phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) as a Measure of Safety
measure.description: For the Run-in and double-blind phases of the study, the focus of this study was changed before unblinding to a safety study due to early termination and having enrolled only 35% of the planned sample size. Therefore, the safety data is presented for the run-in and double-blind and overall exposure to BTDS, which includes the extension phase.
measure.population: The full analysis population consisted of all subjects who were randomized into the double-blind phase and received at least 1 dose of double-blind treatment.

class.title: All Other Adverse Events in ≥ 4.5% of Subjects

reported_events.time_frame: Subjects with AEs that were ongoing at subject's last study visit were followed until resolution or 30 days after last visit, whichever came first. AEs reported during 7 days following last visit were followed until resoultion or 30 days after last visit.
reported_events.desc: AEs were learned of through spontaneous reports and subject interview.

group.title: Double-blind Placebo Patch
group.description: Reference Treatment placebo 10 or 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10/20
group.description: Test treatment buprenorphine transdermal patch (BTDS) 10 or BTDS 20 applied for 7-day wear

group.description: Open-label Run-in period (BTDS 5, 10, or 20) applied for 7-day wear

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated early for administrative reasons. The efficacy data are not presented since the primary objective of this study was changed identifying it as a safety study.
